meanings.definition: To make a low guttural sound of hostility in the throat.
meanings.sent1: The dog growls when it feels threatened.
meanings.sent2: She growls at strangers to show her displeasure.
meanings.sent3: The cat growls playfully at the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The thunder growls in the distance, warning of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The engine growls as the car accelerates down the road.

meanings.definition: A low, guttural sound of hostility.
meanings.sent1: The growls of the bear echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: She heard the growls of the dog from the other side of the fence.
meanings.sent3: The stomach's growls reminded him it was time for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The growls of the engine signaled a problem under the hood.
meanings.sent5: The growls of the wind outside made the windows rattle.
